page.title: 15Historical Houses
page.content: There are a number of historical houses in Hatfield Peverel. Here is some information about three of them. Toppinghoe Hall is about four hundred years old, originally there were two houses and it is believed that Oliver Cromwell's neice once lived there. Both houses were in ruins until about 1965 when the older of the two was renovated and extended. All that remains of the other house is two walls propped up with poles. Toppinghoe Hall is now owned by Strutt and Parker Estate Agents but Lady Sinclair lives there as a tenant. Crix is another interesting old house, it was built in 1768 after the original medieval house by the river was knocked down because it was damp inside. It was thought that the house got this unusual name because the original owners were called De Cryke
